Reviews.Title: “BIG dissapointment.”
Reviews.Author: Livingthedreamco
Reviews.Content: The donna laura palace is a 3 star hotel. Clean and modest. It doesn't have anything that will make your stay special. Old furniture and a mediocre concierge that could't speak english. I was supposed to stay 8 days with my 16 person family. When we got there we completely lost the feeling of being in a good hotel. The rooms were small and badly decorated. The smelled like javel. The big "suite" was composed of a sofa and a queen sized bed. When we saw this we packed up and went to the Westin Excelsior. That completely changed our stay. You can check out my review of the westin aswell. In overall this isn't a bad hotel but it sure isn't a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SE27Eagle
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the more recent reviews I was apprehensive - in fact a very positive experience in a modest but clean and utterly respectable hotel. It is a fair trot from the centre but as other reviewers point out, about 10 minutes from Lepanto and about the same from Piazza del Popolo and the bottom of the Borghese Gardens, so not exactly remote. Staff unfailingly courteous and helpful; breakfast buffet fine but make sure you ask them to make you fresh coffee rather than using the self-service machine, which is only one notch above what you can get in Kwik-Fit waiting for your tyre to be changed. Room was small but very clean and all that we needed for a weekend where we were going to spend most of the time out of it. It's not a four star hotel - more like a 3.5 - but the price we paid on Expedia was very low. I'd cheerfully return.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zekiep
Reviews.Content: Congratulations to the staff at the Donna Laura Palace for making our first few hours in Rome so fantastically awful! Having travelled all day to get there, we were told that we were being moved to another hotel, because they had been "obliged" to give 12 customers their room back when the airline cancelled their flight. Now..... Thats complete and utter B.S. and we knew it, and the idiot on the desk knew that we knew it, but what could we do?? We were reassured that we were going just 5 minutes away to another hotel within the LO.AN group and was also 4 star. Well - 45 minutes later when we arrived at "Hotel Flemming" (a whole other review in itself!) it was most certainly NOT 4*. 2* would be being kind. We were reassured by our Donna Laura staff that we would have a taxi back the next day as soon as we wanted to return. This was, yet another, lie. The next day we were told we would have to wait 30 minutes for a minibus to take us over to the hotel. We kindly suggested they do as promised and get us a (paid for) taxi (when I say kindly suggested - I'm being "polite" - as were already a little upset at the way we'd been treated) and eventually a taxi was arranged. When we got there - the little bell boy was all excited - telling us that his football team had come to stay at the hotel last night! Interesting........ 12 rooms "given up" to the imaginary travellers who's flight were cancelled, and conveniently - a football team comes to stay!!!! Throughout our whole stay the staff on the desk were ignorant and rude and very clearly did not want us staying there. "It's a local hotel - for local people" (apologies to those who have not seen league of gentlemen!). They did the bare minimum they had to do to "help" us with any requests (ie a taxi) but no more then they had to do and NEVER a smile! The rooms were average for a 3* hotel, small but reasonably comfortable. Once you have your bearings it's just a 15-20 min walk into Rome centre and the sights. There are plenty of reasonable restaurants in walking or short taxi distance - all of which are "off the beaten track" and better than the "tourist" places. Anyway- was pleased to leave the hell-hole and won't be returning. Will be suggesting Expedia remove this hotel from their British web-site.

Reviews.Title: “Gave my room to the Football team”
Reviews.Author: Edward P
Reviews.Content: I secured a reservation here many months ago. Unfortunately upon arrival they informed me that they must give my room to some people whose flight was cancelled. They did arrange accommodation for me in a nearby hotel for the first night of a 7 night stay. That hotel was supposedly a 4 star hotel but was a bedbug infested hell hole (Grand Hotel Fleming). We then came back to the Donna Laura and were told by another member of staff that the football team was there yesterday (the real reason why we lost our room). The hotel gave me no discount and no apology and I even had to argue to get cab fare paid between the 2 hotels. They are liars and thieves. Avoid or the same may happen to you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel .. a bit too far from the action though”
Reviews.Author: Sevenfortyfive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights in Rome. This hotel is nice but could use some updates to make it even nicer. Breakfast buffet was included and was good. Fitness center was nice. Our bedding was less than luxurious .. blanket was a bit rough so we didn't use it at all. The towels were really nice. Be careful with the hot water in the shower/tub .. it's a bit unpredictable .. If the hotel was closer to Piazza de Popolo or Navona, I'd recommend it to everybody. Truthfully, we will stay within a 5 minute walk from Piazza de Navona when we return to Rome someday.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague.”
Reviews.Author: PERES P
Reviews.Content: We are two single females who booked our twin room 6 months ago. We turned up at midnight to be told our room had been double booked and that we were being sent to another hotel. Having being forewarned by other Trip Advisors that this is a scam to ship you out to a worse hotel for the whole duration of the holiday we refused point blank to go. After getting no where with the receptionist we then climbed into our pyjamas and slept in reception hoping to shame them into giving us a room. We were eventually offered a glass of water and the lights were dimmed when they realised they had met with an impasse. The next day after being shown to an uncleaned room as the cleaners weren't in yet we showered unpackied and had breakfast. We then set the safe up to store our valuables. We both checked the safe was locked before we went out. When we returned in the evening my friend noticed 50 euros had been taken. Whoever took it had hoped a single note wouldn't have been noticed but my friend divides her money by the days she was stopping so realised straightaway. We went to reception who said they had never had anything like this happen before and they sent someone upstairs to check the safe. The safe now wasn't accepting our code which it was previously and the hotel staff member said we mustn't have set it incorrectly like that was a viable excuse for money to be taken. Later when we went to reception and spoke to the another receptionist about going to the police station he knew nothing about the incident. If this was the first time it had ever happened I would have thought it would have been the talk of the hotel but they appeared to be pretty nonchalant about it. There was no tea making facilities in the room but when you asked for a drink either in the bar/restroom or room service you were told there was no one available. The hotel is not central you have to walk 10 minutes to a metro station to get to anywhere. A lovely trip spoilt. Don't think it is a one off and book. Read the other reviews and "Avoid like the Plague" Oh and I noticed we were the only English speaking guests there. Are they just "Double booking" the non Italians? I wondered.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but too far away from the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Georginamc
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, the staff were helpful. Rooms were clean.but it is a bit far from the centre of Rome. If you wanted an evening meal you had to head back into to the centre of Rome! the Hotel did have a restaurant but not great. we did however on the last day find a lovely Restaurant five mintues down the road(turn left coming out of the Hotel and follow the main road and it is just on the corner) called Rossopomodoro. we also found a supermarket which was great as the prices in Rome are not cheap. The supermarket was just at the back of the Hotel( turn right,then right again,two minutes from the Hotel) so glad we found it. Rome was a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it, nice rooms, good quiet location”
Reviews.Author: not-a-redshirt
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised how nice and comfortable our stay was at this hotel. We stayed 4 nights and the staff was most helpful to our needs. The residential Prati neighborhood where the hotel is located along the edge of has some nice restaurants, lovely street markets and a great cafe just a few minutes walk away (no coperto!). It takes about 20 minutes to walk to the Vatican or the piazza del popolo on the opposite side of the Tiber. The buffet breakfast was average and could have been better if there was more variety, or at least come change from day to day. Bathrooms are modern and well appointed, beds comfortable. Free wifi is not available.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I've ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: Cp16
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel. I will never return or recommend. Only one employee the whole time was nice. I paid to use their computer and it stopped working. The man at the front desk was so rude when I asked about it. The jacuzzi stopped working during my stay and they did not care to fix it. In the first few days of our stay, we tried calling room service atleast 10 times and everytime it was busy (we suspected they just took the phone of the hook because we never saw too many people in the hotel). I finally called the front desk to ask about it and was told "if it's busy, it's busy" before being hung up on. The rooftop terrace was never open and when I asked about that I was told that it's only open sometimes when there is someone to work up there. Shower leaks water all over the floor. They advertise a smoke-free environment yet there are ashtrays lining the halls and constantly smelt of cigarette smoke. On top of all that, it is in a noisy area nowhere near the popular places. I've stayed at $80 motels that were nicer than this.

Reviews.Title: “Rather pretentious, but pleasant location.”
Reviews.Author: AJC32
Reviews.Content: Not sure that this would be the ideal hotel for a first time visitor to Rome keen to do all the sights, but we liked the fact it is that it is slightly off the main tourist track and the rather smart area around the nearby Piazza Mazzini is full of Romans, not foreigners. The nearest metro station is a 10 minute walk, and very pleasant in the spring sunshine.However, being on the Lungotevere dei Armi, there is constant traffic noise which is only partially excluded by the double glazing; so if you need silence to sleep this is not the place for you, although it didn't bother us too much. Beware also that the 'double bed' is a small and old-fashioned 4' 6" (140 cm), which could also be a problem for many... The staff were friendly and helpful, and the receptionists spoke English well, but the service was a little haphazard (eg. couldn't find anyone to serve at the bar early evening). Overall I would stay here again at the right rate, but there are better 4 star hotels in Rome I would use in preference.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, especially for young tourists”
Reviews.Author: Tudor0206
Reviews.Content: I booked on the internet a standard room at this hotel. The hotel is refurbished, lovely rooms, a little bit small but enough if you intend to spend the day in town. Room was very clean, bathroom as well. The continental breakfast was good. It was interesting, many cakes and croissants were served. Scrambled eggs, salami, cheese and ham were also. Coffee tasted like soluable and juice like chemical....probably because they were served by a machine.....they should change that. The area is lovely, with wonderful villas with apartments, on the banks of Tiber. Vatican is one metro station away (5-7 min to station) or 3 tram stations which leaves you right at the Vatican wall (2-3 mins to station). I recommend the hotel to people coming for sightseeing or business.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: rwarri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 4 star (Italian style - so not quite a full 4 star location). It is north of the centre and just off the maps handed out by the local hotels - so clearly a bit of a way out. Not too bad if you don't mind walking - quite a stroll to the metro too...... so a bit isolated especially if you come back to the hotel and then want to go out for a evening meal! Rooms average and room air con was ineffective - so rather too warm - and leaving the window open meant the traffic noise was loud..... bed had a very hard mattress! The staff were friendly and generally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Mediocre Overall”
Reviews.Author: beng775
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not nearly as centrally located as it attempts to convey. The employees all hardly spoke english and seemed very uninterested in our enjoyment of the stay. The bed was very hard even for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: hunnnny
Reviews.Content: very good hotel for the price....5-10 minutes walk to Lepanto metro station...make sure you purchase a weekly pass first thing and the public transportation would get you to all the sites you want to visit in Rome...( the subway cars come every 2-3 minutes )...many good restaurants within a short walk : Tastevin, Al59 and Cacio e Pepe just to name a few....Pizzerias are everywhere and very enjoyable for lunches and even supper...take a open bus tour of the city ( the kind that you can hop on and off as many times as you wish )..book on line for visits to Sistine Chapel and Borghese Museum, they cost more but will save you a few hours of lineup....

Reviews.Title: “nice room; great breakfast but far from trhe metro and the staff is bad!”
Reviews.Author: ATLfan
Reviews.Content: the room was fine but the bed was a little firm, breakfast was great- 10 different pastries, eggs, meat, cheese etc. there are a lot of bars, osteria's etc nearby- and there is a bus that goes to the Coliseum area and trams but the staff has no clue as to how to direct you to find them. by our 4th day- when we checked out we finally had it figured out. ALways walk to the river first and then go south toward the metro or you can easily get lost- do not depend upon directions from locals they are clueless as to the address

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but VERY noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Vixx0
Reviews.Content: Overall look of hotel is nice (though rooms a tiny bit dated and sparce) and staff were helpful (though often too busy be able to serve promptly). On my first evening I made the mistake of eating in the hotel (mainly because I had been awake since 3.30 in the morning to catch an early flight and then been working all day in the office and I couldn't see any signs of nearby restaurants). The menu was limited and very expensive (over €50 for a steak, 2 side dishes (veg & potatoes), a glass of fruit juice and a pudding). When the food arrived it was edible but definitely not up to the usual standards of Italian food. Bed was made up with only a sheet so, as it was a bit chilly I used the blanket from the cupboard. Unfortunately the blanket was very dirty (covered in other peoples' hair etc so obviously hadn't been washed recently) which really put me off but I did use it anyway. However, as the night went on I found I was too hot so opened the window but the traffic noise was horrendous. In fact, even the noise from other rooms (loud TVs etc) was clearly audible. Therefore, this, combined with a very hard and uncomfortable bed, meant I didn't get a lot of sleep. Breakfast was also a disappointment. Common problems were: - Having to sit at a table which had not been cleared after the previous guest had used it. - No milk to have with cereals - Limited fresh fruit (grapes only) - Burnt pastries - No fresh fruit juice (what tasted like cordial could be obtained from a machine) These are things which I suppose you could put up with if the price was lower. However, I would not stay in this hotel again. In fact, I am due to be working in Rome for the next 3 weeks and have changed to an alternative. I have previously stayed in the 21 Hotel which I can thoroughly recommend (sadly it was full when I tried to book this trip).

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish,Rubbish,Rubbish......Beware of Fraud”
Reviews.Author: Meropenem
Reviews.Content: I have never written a reivew in my life and after this horrible trip i decided to do one on my return to Uk.They exactly did same thing to us,made us stay in a third class cheap hotel on our arrival giving excuses that no room is available as previous occupants flights have been cancelled and they have to accommodate them as priority. They made us stay in a cheap "Grand Hotel" which was miles away from main city links.I was 20 weeks pregnant and it was horrible for me to walk that long.It just ruined our romantic rome holiday. Receptionist was least considerate and everytime we asked something she ignored behaving she doesnot understand single word of english.It was just too unacceptable. I think there is whole chain of this fraud,they overbook innocent customers and than finally make them stay in cheap hotel.I think its all well planned to run two hotels at the same time and there is no legislation to cuff these thieves. Plz never book this hotel if u want to stay away from hasstle.

Reviews.Title: “rubbish dont bother”
Reviews.Author: karlito6
Reviews.Content: if you have reserved this hotel dont expect them to honour it..expect to be on the streets like we ended up this so called hotel is a joke by any standards we put in a reservation a few months ago and when we got there our room had been sold on for more money...these guys are clowns stay away

Reviews.Title: “Beware of overbooking”
Reviews.Author: rouletta
Reviews.Content: Read several reviews before we booked,and got very mixed reviews,which should have been a clue. The rooms are not the issue here(they are adequate). We ourselves did not have this probloem,but would never stay here again,because we heard many couples being re-routed to their sister hotel. In the three nights that we were there,we heard at least six couples being told the same overbooking story. After travelling all day,the last thing you want is this hassle. They are not the most gracious hosts we've run into. I wanted to print my boarding pass,and was told that their printer in lobby wasn't working,but if I would like,I could pay 7 euros for 20 minutes and send him an email and he would print my pass. "insane"

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Daizita
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a balcony room--don't bother asking for one--no view and the busy road makes the auto pollution intolerable. Indifferent reception staff; room was 2 single beds close together but ok. Due to some previous negative reviews on the breakfast that's included, we weren't sure what to expect. On both Sunday and Monday mornings we found the offerings extensive. The only warm dish was scrambled eggs, but there were plenty of other choices to supplement that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Catto4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty much what we expected, clean and tidy everything worked, and the air con was a godsend. The hotel was a little further out than we had anticipated and did involve a lot of walking, which in the heat of August was a little difficult and very tiring. Although I would not hesitate to stay here again in the cooler months. The hotel breakfast was continental but there was always plenty of it and you could have as much or as little as you liked. If there was on down side to this hotel it is that the noise travels we were woken in the night on several occasions by people arriving or leaving the hotel, and in our room next doors toilet filling with water sounded like it was in the same room as us.

Reviews.Title: “Great room... shame about the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: i_am_error
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome for a much needed break, and got a flight/hotel package at a reasonable price. As far as the room goes, it was very good. I was impeccable (good for me, since I'm a cleanliness freak!) and decorated nicely. The beds were very comfortable, if a touch firm. Our room had aircon, which was more a necessity than a luxury in the heat of Rome, and was definitely welcome. The Service was fantastic; the room was cleaned daily, and all toiletries replaced. The hotel was a short walk from a metro station; it wasn't too far (about 10 minutes walk), but occasionally the trek in the heat made it somewhat of a chore. There was also a small supermarket just behind the hotel, which proved amazingly useful for buying water (the prices in the minibar were absolute robbery; don't bother). There's also a wonderful restaurant, Rossopomodoro, a short walk from the hotel, which serves up some of the best meals in the city. If you're too tired to walk, the hotel has a restaurant on the roof, which was better than I was expecting it to be, though pricy if you don't go for the chef's special. However, there were a few problems... First of all, the breakfast was simply unacceptable. The buffet consisted of stale cake, diluted juice, warm watermelon, the thinnest slices of toast I have ever seen in my life, and cheap industrial coffee with powdered milk. For a four-star hotel, this was a crushing disappointment. The charges for wifi and internet access were also steep. It costs €7 for 24 hours, which wasn't too bad, but to use the computer in the lobby costs €7 an hour, which is incredibly mean if all you want to do is online check-in. Overall, I enjoyed my stay; however, if you want a decent breakfast, I recommend going out and finding a nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms- a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: SaraGood
Reviews.Content: The room was WAY bigger than the ones we stayed in for both Venice and Milan. Even had a 110v outlet. It was a bit out of the city center but close to the Vatican. We had no issues with street noise and I liked the breakfast. Lunch meat, cheese, danishes, eggs, yogurt, cereal, juice... what more do these people want? Saw American movie star here but won't say who to protect his privacy. The pool was being cleaned and was therefore closed while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and close to metro”
Reviews.Author: kiwitraveller98
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, crap service but always expect that in italy. Metro close by and the metro is really cheap in Rome. nice area but not the centre of town, however very cheap and not a dodgy area like by the train station. Worth what we paid to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel ruined our trip!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: runawaykinms
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before in my life. However, after my expierience with Hotel Donna Laura, I felt that I must write one in hopes to save a future traveler the troubles we had. We arrived at the Hotel Donna Laura around 3pm on the date of our check in and spoke to the staff there. They informed us that some of there previous travelers had missed there flight and returned to the hotel around 1pm. He then told me that they have no choice but to accept those travelers back and he had to give our room to them. After this explaination he stated that our only option was to be moved to another hotel. We did not have a choice in this matter, as the second hotel was picked for us. The staff led us to believe that the hotel was close to the Donna Laura, that it was nice, and that we could come back to the Donna Laura the next day. After arriving at the second hotel, we soon realized that we had a problem. Not only was the hotel of a lower standard than the Donna Laura it was no where close to any places of interest. Each day, we had to ride a bus for about 45mins to get to a metro station, or pay a taxi both ways each time we wanted to leave the hotel. Because we had several planned tours at very early hours we did not have the freedom to take the bus and spent hundreds of dollars in taxi fees during our stay. After our first night at the second hotel we called the Hotel Donna Laura back to arrange moving back to their hotel as they had promised. However, they told us that they still did not have our room avaliable and would not be able to move us. We explained that we had trouble getting to our tours that we had already paid for prior to our visit and asked if they could at least move us to another one of their sister hotels that is closer to the city. They told us that they would not do that. In fact one of the staff said, "That is not our problem." They never ended up accomadating us and we were stuck at the second hotel for the entire trip. This really took a toll on us both financially and emotionally. Everyday we were stressed to make it on time to our tours and had a hard time relaxing. We lost a lot of sleep due to all the extra needed travel time. In summary, I read other reviews on this hotel that were very similar to this, but thought that 1. This wouldn't happen to me or 2. The person writing the review was "crazy". I hope that by writing this review at least one person will be turned away from this hotel and will be able to have a risk free trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE, TRAVELER BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: jamies33
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff gave away our reservation to a previous traveler who had missed their flight then the moved to a "sister" hotel that was not near a metro station, which forced us to use taxis, which was an unexpected expense. The hotel staff was extremely rude. The hotel that we were moved to was disgusting

Reviews.Title: “We had a very good weekend, the hotel was very good.”
Reviews.Author: Backpacker5258
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were a bit apprehensive on what we would find at the hotel however it surpassed our expectations. The room we had was very good, it was cleaned daily. The breakfast was more than adequate, a good selection and lots of it. The staff were helpful and quite happy to give info when we requested it. We caught the train from the airport to Termini station and from there we took the metro to Lepanto station, the hotel was approx 10 mins walk away, that was the only time we used the Metro. For the rest of the weekend we walked everywhere. Rome is a lovely city and because we walked everywhere we felt we saw more of the city than if we had taken the metro. All in all we had an excellent weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: popab
Reviews.Content: The triple room was very noisy, the feeling was of sleeping on the margin of the highway... not soundproof at all. After one day we've asked to switch the room and we received a ... double one with suplementary bed (no money back for the difference of comfort, of course)... The breakfast was one of the worst we ever met, the staff actioned very lazy at our requests (an aditional blanket, to prepare the sauna etc) or not al all... Furthermore, we had the big surprise that the code of the safe hasn't work after one day (one guy from staff came and open it in 1 second). We had the feeling that some of our money dissapeared (we never thought that is mandatory to check the amount we have put in...). At the and of the day, an expensive and unhappy experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, must walk a little to get to transportation”
Reviews.Author: hy41573
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, staff was friendly and helpful. About a 10 minute walk from the metro. You can walk to all the major sites - Spanish steps, Vatican City, Colosseum - but wear comfortable shoes

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: brianmac1957
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Donna Laura Palace for a weekend in October 2009. We had booked the Deluxe Triple Room which was spacious, well furnished and more than fitted the bill. Reception staff were pleasant enough although didn't exactly go above and beyond the call of duty! The area in which the hotel is located is a bit out from the historic centre of Rome but you can walk it in about 20 minutes or so. The easiest way to get in and out of the city centre is by Metro and the Lepanto Metro Station is only about 10 minutes from the hotel. Overall the Donna Laura Palace was very good value for money and you would need to pay almost double the cost if you wanted a 4 star hotel in the city centre - so like most things in life - you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “I don't know where these others were staying....but I found it Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: luna-pixie
Reviews.Content: Seriously. I really can not understand the difficulties people had with this hotel. I did a really stupid thing, so I thought. I picked this hotel purely on the photos I saw whilst browsing through my holiday provider. I didn't read any reviews until the night before I flew and thought that I had made the biggest mistake of my life. As this was a special occasion for myself and my partner; I didn't want a run of the mill hotel- but not being a millionaire I couldn't afford something top of the range either. The Donna Laura Palace looked nice. A bit better than nice- so after reading the reviews on this site- my heart sunk. However, after finding the hotel- which I believe is perfectly placed if you don't mind walking for more than five minutes- I couldn't have been more welcomed and looked after anywhere else. The receptionist (called Danilo) was amazing and he couldn't do enough for us- and nothing was too much trouble. The guy at the bar and the waiter who served us our evening meal (even though it was exceptionally late) were so lovely, I knew that the reviews on this site couldn't be right. Ok, I will concur that the evening meal was not wonderful and it wasn't the best that I had in Rome- but it wasn't that bad either. Perfectly edible and about the right price for a hotel. The Donna Laura Palace Hotel is situated approximately 10 mins from Lepanto Metro- as long as you know where you are going. You can walk to Piazza del Popolo in around 15 mins and it took me the grand total of 35 mins to get to the Colosseum. It's miles away from everything- isn't it?! The Vatican museums are around 20 mins away and you are surrounded by Alimentari (grocery shops), gellateria (ice-cream shops), restaurants, trattorias and on the Cola de Rienzo you have boutiques, electrical shops and general high street stuff! Amazing- if that's what you came to Rome for. I have to admit that I spent quite a lot of my time in Rome walking from one place to another- but if I had really wanted to, I could have tripped about 5-10mins down the road and bought my metro ticket and got to wherever I wanted in about 5mins as the metro seems to run every minute. I even took my luggage on the metro. It really wasn't a problem. Yes, the Donna Laura is on a main road- but it is set back and has a lovely little courtyard at the front surrounded by trees (and it has a pomegranate tree in the centre!). And no the taxi's won't pull up outside the door- but I suppose it must be a real struggle to get the luggage all 20 metres from the road to the door. But I knew all of this, I checked to see where it was on google maps before I went. I did this because I wanted to make sure that I wasn't too far out of central Rome- and this hotel is far from that. All the staff were friendly and spoke English (and even humoured me when I tried to speak very poor Italian!), the room was clean, comfortable, big and well decorated and the check in and out procedure was fast and efficient. I was so impressed with this hotel that I will return. No question. I don't think I would ever stay anywhere else in Rome, even if I was loaded. I even told them so on the way out.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service -”
Reviews.Author: easytrekker
Reviews.Content: We finally arrived at the hotel after a long train journey from Florence. The entrance hall of hotel looked good and we were looking forward to a warm welcome. However, the reception staff told us that there was a problem with our room (no electricity or hot water) and that they'd reserved us a room at their sister hotel even further away from the city. We questioned this further - why only with one room surely this would affect the whole floor? We refused to go to the other hotel and asked to view our room but they eventually gave us a room on the ground floor when we said that we'd like a refund (reservation was pre-booked). The room was too small and right next to the noisey entrance. This incident made us feel very unwelcome as tourists - the hotel generally favours business guests more. Otherwise hotel is clean, the breakfast is okay, coffee awful. But the jacuzzi was a great treat after a long day of site seeing. We have read similar experiences on trip advisor before booking, hence why we stuck to guns about not moving! Book at your discretion but be aware. With hindsight, would not have booked with this hotel and paid a bit more for better service and more central location. PS. Good tram service to Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotelroom was 9/10 the breakfast 1/10”
Reviews.Author: heninjustine
Reviews.Content: Like I said the hotelroom was good but the breakfast was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “The Deluxe Triple Room...I Think Not!”
Reviews.Author: MaryN13
Reviews.Content: We booked the triple deluxe room for a weekend trip with our young niece. The room was a standard double with a third bed squeezed into the limited space. I asked at reception but was told that a deluxe triple is just a standard double with another bed put into the room. It was nothing like the description or photo on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Staff with attitude”
Reviews.Author: jane1905
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel were nice, clean and quiet. Can't complain about them. Some of the staff had serious attitude. On our departure on the last day, we asked the man at the reception to call us a taxi. He made a phone call, said it would be €70 to the airport. We told him we had just paid €50 on the way there but he replied that the rate was €70. When the taxi didn't arrive within 20 minutes, we were a little pushed for time and luckily managed to hail a taxi. That driver told us that the rate to the airport from that area was in fact €50. Turned out the man at the reception was going to keep the extra €20. Having seen some of the prices for NY Eve meals in Rome city centre, we decided to stay in the hotel which was a little cheaper. NOT SURPRISING. The food was terrible. 5 courses, each getting worse. The bar was not open at any stage on NY Eve so we couldn't even get a drink there. The breakfast in the hotel was wholly inadequate. The Orange Juice was not fresh juice but tasted more like Berocca (Vitamin tablets). The food sat out all day from one day to the next. The only hot food available was a radioactive looking scrambled egg. The selection was modest to say the least. On a happier note, the porter was lovely as was the bar man (when he was there).

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: LaurenEJ
Reviews.Content: Of the three hotels we stayed in during our trip to Italy, this was the most expensive and the most disappointing. When we checked in, we found cigarette ashes on the bathroom floor and hairs on the sheets. Some members of the front desk staff were wonderful, but some were rude and seemed bothered to have to send an extra towel to our room and answer our (simple and straightforward) questions. Our tub leaked water all over the floor (through the drain, we think) and there was very poor ventilation, which left the bathroom steamy and very hot long after we were done showering. And I'm sorry, I understand that things are different in Europe than in the US, but at this price, the air conditioning should work and keep the room at least moderately comfortable (even if on the warm side of comfortable). Know that it is out of the way and very far from nearly all of the popular tourist sites (not that big a deal if you're mobile, bad if a member of your party has limited mobility). Also, skip the hotel restaurant (at least for lunch). We were the only people there and the food was not good. Dinner was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay there.”
Reviews.Author: JanWinters
Reviews.Content: Attention The Manager of the Donna Laura Palace, I was recently a guest there on Lungotevere delle Armi,21-00195 Roma. My family and I were traveling through London, Paris and Rome. In London and Paris we were treated with little to no respect and given no help at all. We assumed that is how Europeans treated budget American travelers, that was until we met Sicvano and Giacanni at your hotel. There was nothing too much for them to do to make our visit there one of the best vacations we have ever had. They were kind, respectful, and very helpful. They made us feel like we were special guests. They were wonderful. Your hotel was lovely, clean, and comfortable. The other places we stayed were nothing by comparison. I guess you can tell we loved your staff and our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong choice”
Reviews.Author: Athlet
Reviews.Content: If you look for an unfriendly 4 star hotel on a noisy area and love to have breakfast drinking orange juice (actually water with some powder) in a plastic glass, this hotel is the place to be. The most striking thing was how cold and unfriendly the staff was, the hotel restaurant average and extremely overpriced. The location too far from public transport and from downtown, and very close to a very noisy street. No information whatsoever at the room (after insisting a lot we finally got a list of important phone numbers) The rooms quite nice, but too small. one of the two lifts failed every now and then As I said, if you go to Rome, try somewhere else, because the city is more than worthy !!

Reviews.Title: “Present for my wife and her sister”
Reviews.Author: SpencerT
Reviews.Content: I am afraid that the only points I scored by booking this site seeing trip for my wife and her sister were for the site seeing. The report that follows is on their behalf and a result of what they told me about the trip. If it had been me I would have walked to another hotel I am sure. They found the staff to be rude and unhelpful even though I had told them by email that my wife and her sister would need a little help in organising their siteseeing. They offered no help at all. The hotel bragged in all their advertising about the beautifull views from the balcony and roof garden where you would be able to dine and relax. The fact was that they were refused admission even to see the views or sit and relax. On the last day they tried to get up there again and were told that it was not open. They then asked for somewhere to sit and relax preffereably in the sun but they were told that the hotel had nowhere to do this at all. They had one meal there and refused to pay for it as the Turkey was red with blood and service was hopeless. They also tried to order sandwiches via the room service one evening and were told after waiting a long time that there was no bread. They found this to be strange as when they went for breakfast bread was about all they had to offer. To end the trip my wife and her sister told the staff that they needed the taxi to take them to Ciampino(CIA) airport and reitterated this several times. On the way to the airport my wife noticed that the airport signposted was not the same and asked the driver. He said that was the airport that the hotel had told him to go to. He turned around and took them to Ciampino(CIA) and they just made it but with a much larger bill. To sum up My wife and her sister both said that they were happy as they had seen what they had wanted to see for many years "Rome". They would both strongly recomend that you all think twice before listening to any of the other reviews that give this hotel a glowing report as for them it was a disaster area. For my part I had to get the hotel up on the screen to prove to my wife that the hotel was actually listed over here as a four star. She could not believe it!!!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable oasis from the heat”
Reviews.Author: Lisatravel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very hot (35-39 degrees), yet enjoyable weekend in Rome, staying at the Donna Laura. Having read previous reviews, we were aware of some people's comments/complaints, but wanted to reassure future readers that our stay was trouble free and a relaxing break away. We found the service impeccable, from bar staff, wait staff through to reception, often going out of their way to be helpful (as we found when trying to watch a pay for view rugby game with the english speaking conceirge translating instructions from his younger techno friendly staff member), and the hotel facilities and air conditioned rooms very nice The roof terrace was open from 5-11pm every night we were there and we also stayed on the 4th floor but were not disturbed by any furniture moving...(maybe it was just too hot to be moving furniture around!). We recommend using the Donna Laura associated taxi to airports as for a standard 50 euro, we enjoyed the stress free ride in a late model chartered Mercedes with a respectful and friendly driver. We recommend this hotel, but do be aware that you need to factor in taxi's to main areas, even the Vatican etc as the heat meant the normally enjoyable 20min walk was less than bearable. Be aware also, that the Vatican Museum closes at 12:45 on a Saturday, and is not open on a Sunday, so be prepared for every tour guide in Rome to turn up at 8:30...and the queue is a hot wait in the sun. The audio guide for St Peters is a well spent 5 euro and a must to easily explain some of the key features and block out the tour groups and disgruntled teenage school groups!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you don't mind walking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at (thurs to Sun) just before the bank holiday. The hotel arranged for a taxi to pick us up from the airport (called Angelo), he was brilliant. Everyone in Rome drives fast and he was no exception!! If you mail the hotel direct, they will give you a fixed price. Angelo drove out of his way to show us where to queue for the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City, he also told us to get there by 8 in the morning , and are we glad we did. Some people queued for 4 hours due to getting there later. We arrived at 8.15am, the chapel opened at 8.45am and we were in by 9.20am. Allow yourself a day in vatican City as there is loads to see. Back to the hotel, I have read the previous reports, we found no problems with the safe and the reception staff spoke perfect English and couldn't have been more helpful. However, I do agree with the bar closing early. The info at the hotel states 11 o'clock, but it was shut long before this when we stayed. The Terrace Restaurant doesn't open until June 01. The rooms were clean and of a good size, as was the bathroom. The maids cleaned every day and always to a high standard. The walk to Vatican City was fine, but consider the Metro for anywhere futher, the Metro takes you straight to the Colliseum. The hotel is a good 20 minute walk to Trevi Fountain etc, but quite a scenic walk

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't be my idea of a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublinadvisor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April 2005. It is located on a busy road but set back a little so the noise was not excessive. It is close enough to the Vatican but not much else (sightseeing wise) We found the staff very unfriendly. We returned one evening from a long day of sightseeing only to be told at 10.00pm that the bar was closed! I asked the guy behind reception for a box or card of matches. He did look in a drawer and announced he had none. I asked him, had they no matches in the entire hotel and he said no they hadn't!!! We found the room very very small and the bathroom was tiny and the air conditioning didn't work. I was glad I wasn't there at the height of the summer. Having said the above, it was a day after the new Pope was announced and I guess hotel rooms were at a premium in Rome. It served our purpose in the end as we left the hotel every morning after breakfast and did not return until very late each evening. The choice of breakfast was good enough apart from the coffee and the room was clean and tidy. But, would I go back? Not a chance. I think there is better value to be had elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “take care of your belongings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and they're all pretty accurate. With one exception. Well two, but one is waaaaay more important! The less important one is regarding staff at the reception: not very friendly or helpful and at times acting as if they've never spoken english before. The other one is regarding the SAFE in the room!!! Don't trust it! Use it to keep your socks or something else but not your money if you have cash! After one day in the city we came back to the room to find the safe not accepting the PIN code. I called the reception and 2 minutes later a guy came with a key. The keys bypassed the PIN code, invalidating it. Obviously I became a little concerned and I counted the money: there was 100E missing (out of the 1500E I had counted in the morning). The reception had no explanation for this and no measure was taken from their part. Being on our honeymoon we refused to go any further with our investigation but you can imagine our rage! The travel agency also tried to solve the issue but without any luck. I won't go into more details but u get the picture. In a nutshell: NO, I WOULDN'T GO THERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “4 days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Annji
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donna Lauren Palace during the first part of OCtober 2005. Initially we wanted a reasonably priced hotel which was in the area of Rome reasonably close to the Vatican. The hotel was just under $200 a night. The hotel is located on a busy street used by commuters. It is set back from the street and the soundproofing is good. As long as you do not open the windows the noise is not noticed. The grounds are nicely landscaped. The lobby is small and the dining room is located on floor "-1" -- or "in the basement" for Americans. The is a small breakfast room also used for dinner on the main floor. Our room, a double, faced the front courtyard. It was nicely sized. The bed was 2 twins pushed together but made up as one bed. The mattress was firm and to our liking. The room contained a small refrigerator and a safe. The storage was good. The bath was very nicely decorated in marble. It contained all amentities including a bidet. The only issue was that the shower curtain could not keep the water from seeping over the front edge of the tub when a shower was taken. This resulted in a wet floor. The restaurant was OK. The food average and a bit overpriced. We found better food and better prices at "local' non tourist restaurants. The Hotel is about a 20 minute brisk walk from the Vatican proper. The walk to the Borghesia park takes you over the Tiber River. It is about a 20 minute brisk walk to the park or to the Piazza del Popolo. From the Piazza del Popolo you can wander down the the Via del Corso as far as the Colosseum. This can take you all day as you see the shops, churches stop for a coffee and see the many interesting side streets.

Reviews.Title: “Previous reviews on this site pretty accurate!”
Reviews.Author: Goldcat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Donna Laura Palace. We had a little trouble finding the hotel as we made the mistake of walking from the Metro (Lepanto). I read on one site for this hotel it was 2 minutes away, this must have been by car as it was more like 10 at a good pace. So location wise abit out in the sticks but then again a quiet-ish area and felt fairly safe. The outside of the hotel is attractive and the rooms are clean and of a reasonable size. We found the Reception staff okay, not overly friendly, one spoke much more English than the other and was more helpful. Breakfast was not the best. The atmosphere in the breakfast room was abit grim, very quiet indeed with little conversation and no music to lighten the mood. The choose of food was limited to a few bread rolls, and it was DIY tea/coffee rather than table service. The roof terrace appeared to be closed most of the time, though that did not stop them moving furniture around (I think above our room) which got abit annoying. As hotels go not brilliant but not bad either. Just have a good lunch and get cabs (which are pretty cheap and a lot nicer than the grubby Metro) and you will be fine. But please hang on to your belongings around Termini Station as my boyfriend got mugged.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JTTraveller1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely friendly and the staff could not be more friendly. The breakfasts were good, although it would have been to have some fresh juice instead of squash. Although the hotel is in the centre of Rome it is about a 20 min walk to most attractions, however if you do not feel like walking taxi are cheapish and the underground is cheap. The hotel is along a fairly busy road but you do not hear the noise with the windows closed. Since the air con works very well there is no need to open the windows. The one problem is that walls are thin and you can sometimes hear the people in the room next door! Overall this is lovely hotel and nice base as if you do not mind walking then you are out of the hustle and bussle of central Rome. The staff were lovely and gave their advice to me and my friend on the best and easist way to get to Lido di Ostia ( a beach about 1 hr from Rome - which is only 4 euros each to get to there) you do though have to pay to use the beach - which is worth it after spending 4 days walking in heat of the Rome. For the price that I paid for the hotel I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “too far out but nice all the same”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel just recently and found it to be a charming place but with the (BIG) fault of being too far out. we wrongly took the advice from the lastminute map and thought the hotel to be in the centre but when we arrived at the hotel we found it to be (well, felt like it the next day) a million miles away from where we expected. however we found the hotel rooms to be extremely comfortable and superbly clean. the staff were very welcoming, especially the man with huge blue eyes, and although the breakfast wasn't a magnificant feast, it was enough to get us happily through the day (well until lunchtime at least). i would recommend this hotel to people wanting to have a quieter stay in rome but those who want to be part of the romantic atmosphere that places like piazza navona provides, well into the early hours of the morning, its probably one to skip. (would also like to point out the walls in the hotel are far too thin as you can hear people peeing in the room next to you and i dont mean the bathroom!!!)

Reviews.Title: “EWinRoma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe there are so many positive reviews about this place. This self appointed 4 star hotel is a sham. The hotel staff is rude, unresponsive and unwilling to help out-of-towners. The gentleman at the desk look like a young jerry louis...which is laughable due to his lack of personality and humor! Moving on to the accomodations... the room was 270 euro per night, the room was the size of a shoebox and the supposed double bed was a glorified twin! I guess you can see i was NOT at all hapy with the DLP! Do not stay here regardless of what the other sham reviews say!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay ar the Donna Laura Hotel in Rome and could'nt fault it in any way. Yes it was on a very busy road but did not hear the noise at all. Lovely air conditioned room with balcony. Great views from roof terrace. Excellent buffet breakfast that kept us going all day!About a 20 minute walk to the vatican. We left our cases at reception on our last day. One piece of advice don't use the taxis - it is an easy journey from the airport using the Leonardo Express train and then metro to the hotel - about a 10 minute walk. Woud certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place!”
Reviews.Author: SanAntoniovisitor
Reviews.Content: Someone should tell this questionably "4 star" hotel that they are in the hospitality business. Never have I encountered such lack of even basic manners toward their guests. They seem totally unconcerned about your comfort or difficulties. Our room had no telephone directory, stationery, pens, brochures listing services or any information about the neighborhood. Three light bulbs were burned out. The coat hangers were made of cheap plastic and would not hold a pair of men's jeans without falling apart. We had to ask for toilet paper since it was not replaced automatically. When we asked for glasses rather than plastic cups we were told to go to the dining room and get them, they were not delivered. And the traffic noise was just indescribly loud even with the windows and curtains closed. We slept with earplugs and it wasn't enough. I would liken the noise to the Indianapolis 500. The dining room was basic and did not open at 7 p.m. for dinner as posted. No atmosphere or service. It was a very disappointing representation of the city of Rome. The hotels we stayed in Milan and Florence were wonderful and their staffs were exceptional and gracious. This hotel looks very nice from the outside but there is nothing to recommend it once you enter. Skip this Donna Laura Palace. There is no hospitality to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Donna Laura Palace is a lovely modern hotel situated across the river from the main attractions of Rome. It is located on a busy main road which runs along with the river. The noise of the road therefore means keeping the windows closed is essential for a goodnights sleep. The walk to the main attractions takes roughly 10-15mins but you do take your life into your own hands dodging the italian drivers. A late night taxi back to the hotel from most of the local piazza's costs about 10 euros. The hotel is kept very clean and tidy. Unfortunately small details such as the main bar never being open in the 5 days we were there and also the beautiful roof terrace, which would be ideal for dinner or an evening drink with views of Rome, was closed without explaination for 2 nights. The service in the main dining room was a bit poor and the staff seemed unused to catering for any number of guests. These factors slightly spoiled the atmosphere of an otherwise lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A tasteful well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: murielk
Reviews.Content: The Donna Laura Palace is a great little hotel, located near some great restaurants and shops. This is a rather upscale and quite area that is not overrun with tourists. However, the major street that runs between the hotel and the river is never without noisy traffic. Altough there is a lovely balcony, the noise level makes it unpleasant to sit for long. The bathroom is beautiful, with the biggest and best tub I ever found in a 3 star hotel in Rome. As for extra towels right away- you'll need them. Unfotrunately. the Italians haven't discovered terry cloth yet... The roof top restaurant has a lackluster menu, but the desserts and wine by the glass saves it. The breakfast is lame, even by Italian standards. Joseph, one of the front desk men, is delightful and the epitome of a professional. He was able to make our stay there very special. Overall, the hotel is populated by Italians, which I find to be the best review of all.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a great stay at The Donna Laura Palace Hotel. It is a very pleasant hotel in a good location - about 15 minutes walk to city centre or 20 to Vatican. The amenities are really good, make sure you see the view from the rooftop terrace, but their greatest asset is their staff. They were very friendly, helpful and couldn't do enough for us. Even little things like leaving suitcases at hotel between check out time and leaving for the airport while making the most of those last few hours (so often a big hassle with so many hotels) was offered free of charge. The evening meal was lovely, but have to agree the breakfast was a bit boring. We were in Rome for 5 days, but still have things to see and will be pleased to come back to the Donna Laura

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Rooms spacious and luxurious for Rome standards”
Reviews.Author: fritzchris
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through the internet and judging by the pictures, we thought it to be a standard Rome Hotel. We were pleasantly suprized when we arrived and noticed how nice of a hotel it is. The price for this hotel was excellent considering a sub-standard 2 star hotel near the ancient city was easily twice as much. This 4 star hotel may be a little ways out of the center, however easily accessable by the metro (Lepanto station) or if your up to it, a nice walk. Very clean and nicely appointed rooms. Marble bathrooms with all the ammenities. I would have to agree with the other reviews that the included breakfast was a dissapointment. However it is good for a coffee and pastry. I would definatley stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It's clean, airy & comfy. Okay for kids, too!”
Reviews.Author: Rahiel
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced and not too far from the main attractions, the Donna Laura Palace is a clean and comfortable hotel with light and airy rooms. Our room felt spacious and had a large double bed (v.comfy) and a sofabed for our daughter which was also good. We had a balcony, working A/C and because we had an end room, our bathroom also had a big window. The bathroom was small but elegant and functional (but why no proper hand and face towels instead of what looked like napkins?). The Hotel's staff were on the whole courteous, welcoming & polite. The fact that we had a child with us was not an off-putting factor. Downside? The hotel is a good 10-minute walk from the nearest metro (Lepanto) and the walk can get tedious. Buses stop nearby, but each time we decided to wait for one, nothing ever came - until we started walking of course! You could get a taxi - it cost us 10 Euros for a cab ride back to the Hotel from the Ancient City. Just as an aside, we never felt uncomfortable walking around the area at night (there are some friendly shops and cafes nearby), and never saw any unsavoury characters during our stay. Food in the hotel was its worst point. We were given a complimentary dessert voucher so we tried the restaurant on the first night. The food was very lacklustre, the bread stale and the fish wasn't salmon (as requested) but swordfish!! And the complimentary dessert? Ice cream or fruit (pineapple). The continental breakfast also lacked excitement. Every day, it seemed like the same old tiny bread rolls, muesli/cornflakes,puffed rice and sweet croissants were being laid out! Bread for toasting and a bigger variety of cereals would have been a nice addition to the cakes, cheese and meat slices. Also, by around 9am, the coffee turns very thick and stewed! But to moan about the food and the lack of niceties such as in-room tea-making facilities or the unavailability of an iron would be churlish. The bottom line is that the DLP is a pleasant hotel and, if you can forgive its foibles, is definitely worth checking out (or checking in, to be more accurate).

Reviews.Title: “Donna Laura Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the Donna Laura by accident, coming in at night from the North. It is on the Tiber River and is a short cab ride away from Vatican City and the historical Roman areas.It's a very nice 4 star Hotel...very elegant and a new structure. I think they said it had been opened for a year or so. It has an attractive entryway, lots of marble in the lobby, and very well decorated guest rooms. They had a very good breakfast.The people were very nice and helped us get our bearings. They also didn't charge us for parking, even though they had to move cars around alot to handle the limited amount of parking they did have. In Italy, and especially in the cities, Free parking is of significant financial advantage. We also found it to be the exception in the citys. Usually parking is E20-25 per night.This was a great Hotel and is highly recommended. It really is nice to settle into a place like the Donna Laura after a busy day in a big city.

HotelInfo.Name: Donna Laura Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Lungotevere delle Armi 21, 00195 Rome, Italy
